title: Why do some people sing when a song is played? Do they really think they can do it better than the singer? - Quora

response.answer_text: I know I can’t sing better than the performer does but I’m certainly not in competition with them, nor am I making any comment on how they sing. I sing because singing is very pleasurable. It can make me feel better when I feel low, and my family knows that if I’m singing, I’m feeling ok, or great, and if I’m not, I’m pretty depressed. If I’m in public, and feel the need, I will sing very, very quietly, but in my car, I belt it out. ( I actually have a nice voice but I have a very limited range, so I can’t hit the high/low notes). Boy do I envy the likes of Cindy Lauper, her range is phenomenal. I don’t care if people see me singing in the car and at home, I sing along with the songs I know on the radio. There’s nothing wrong with singing and when I was a kid at camp, some of the very best times were around the campfire singing our lungs out.

I definitely don’t think I can do it better than the singer. I just like doing it because it makes me happy. In fact, I was concerned about getting headphones because I was slightly concerned I would break into song on the Metro or something. It’s all I can do not to dance sometimes, lol. I have yet to embarrass myself but I’ve come close a couple of times. Also, as a kid I got terrible car sickness. Unfortunately my parents were very much into road trips so I had to figure out how to cope. If I wasn’t curled up asleep in the back seat, I was singing because it helped me not think about my queasiness. I’d have to do the same thing while swinging on our giant swing set so I wouldn’t get sick. I remember belting out Elton John’s “Crocodile Rock” the most. And other songs now that I blush about realizing what I was singing, haha.
